title: Deven Verma
text:
Deven Verma (23 October 1937 – 2 December 2014) was an Indian film and television actor, particularly known for his comic roles, with <a href="Bollywood">Bollywood</a> directors like <a href="Basu%20Chatterji">Basu Chatterji</a>, <a href="Hrishikesh%20Mukherjee">Hrishikesh Mukherjee</a> and <a href="Gulzar">Gulzar</a>. He also produced and directed films, including "<a href="Besharam%20%281978%20film%29">Besharam</a>". He won <a href="Filmfare%20Best%20Comedian%20Award">Filmfare Best Comedian Award</a> for "<a href="Chori%20Mera%20Kaam">Chori Mera Kaam</a>", "<a href="Chor%20Ke%20Ghar%20Chor">Chor Ke Ghar Chor</a>" and "<a href="Angoor%20%281982%20film%29">Angoor</a>".
Life.
Verma was born on 23 October 1937 in <a href="Kutch%20district">Kutch, Gujarat</a>, to Baldev Singh Verma and Sarala Devi and was brought up in <a href="Pune">Pune</a>.His father was Rajasthani and mother belonged to Kutch. His father was a film distributor. He studied at the <a href="Nowrosjee%20Wadia%20College">Nowrosjee Wadia College</a> for Arts and Science (<a href="University%20of%20Pune">University of Pune</a>) (1953–57), graduating with Honours in Politics and Sociology. He married Rupa Ganguly, daughter of late veteran Bollywood actor <a href="Ashok%20Kumar">Ashok Kumar</a> and sister of <a href="Preeti%20Ganguly">Preeti Ganguly</a>.
Deven Verma's original name was Devendu Verma which he changed to Deven in college. Deven Verma had 4 sisters, 2 elder and 2 younger. His younger sisters were twins. His sister's name are Nirupama, Tushar, Amita and Parul.
Apart from Hindi films, Verma acted in a few <a href="Marathi%20language">Marathi</a> and Bhojpuri films.
He died at 2 a.m <a href="Indian%20Standard%20Time">IST</a> on 2 December 2014 in Pune, following a heart attack and kidney failure.
